properties.areaDesc: Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 1:38AM MST until January 30 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...PERIOD OF HEAVY SNOW IN THE NORTHERN BLACK HILLS TODAY...

.A strong upper trough will push through the region today,
supporting periods of moderate to heavy snow in the Northern
Black Hills. Snow amounts of 3 to 5 inches are expected, with
isolated higher amounts possible from Lead to Cheyenne Crossing,
and also in the Bearlodge Mountains. The heaviest snow is expected
this afternoon. Gusty northwest winds will also support areas of
blowing and drifting snow this afternoon.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5
inches, with locally higher amounts possible from Lead to
Cheyenne Crossing. Locations southeast of Rochford to Deerfield
will see generally 2 inches or less. Winds gusting as high as
40 mph will be possible this afternoon.

* WHERE...In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. In South Dakota,
the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills.

* WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
